com.percussion.services.security
Interface IPSRoleMgr

public interface IPSRoleMgr

Provides cataloging services for roles and subjects defined by both internal and external catalogers. Also provides persistence services for external cataloger configurations.

Field Summary

          Type constant for subject catalogers.

                        String type)
                        throws PSSecurityCatalogException
Convenience method that calls findUsers(names, catalogerName, type, null)

Throws:
PSSecurityCatalogException

findUsers

List<Subject> findUsers(List<String> names,
                        String catalogerName,
                        String type,
                        Set<IPSPrincipalAttribute.PrincipalAttributes> supportedTypes)
                        throws PSSecurityCatalogException
Find all matching subjects by querying all subject catalogers and directory providers. See IPSSubjectCataloger.findUsers(List) for more info.

Parameters:
names - The names of the subjects to find. Each would match the name supplied to authenticate the subject. May be null or empty to return all possible subjects. Names may contain wildcards to support filtering. Possible wildcards characters are '_' for match one character, and '%' for match any.
catalogerName - The name of the subject cataloger to query, may be null or empty to query all subject and directory catalogers.
type - The cataloger type, may not be null or empty if catalogerName is supplied, and must match an existing cataloger type. For subject catalogers, use SUBJECT_CATALOGER_TYPE, otherwise it's the IPSDirectoryCataloger.getCatalogerType(). Ignored if catalogerName is not supplied.
supportedTypes - Only catalogers that support all types specified in the set will be queried. For subject catalogers, IPSSubjectCataloger.supportsAttributeType(IPSPrincipalAttribute.PrincipalAttributes) is called. For directory catalogers, IPSPrincipalAttribute.PrincipalAttributes.SUBJECT_NAME is always supported, and for, IPSPrincipalAttribute.PrincipalAttributes.EMAIL_ADDRESS, IPSDirectoryCataloger.getEmailAddressAttributeName() must return a non-emtpy value. May be null or emtpy to disregard this parameter.
Returns:
A list of subjects, never null, may be empty. Internal directory catalogers are queried for defined attributes - an attribute must be defined in the directory's "return attributes", or in the directory set's "required attribute" list to be included in the returned subjects. Note that attributes returned by the Backend-table and OS security providers are automatically exposed by their respective directory catalogers. External cataloger implementations define what attributes they will expose.
Throws:
PSSecurityCatalogException - If there are any errors.

getRoleMembers

Set<IPSTypedPrincipal> getRoleMembers(String roleName)
                                      throws PSSecurityCatalogException
Catalog the members of the specified role.

Parameters:
roleName - The name of the role, may not be null or empty.
Returns:
A set of members, never null, may be empty if no matching role is found or if the role has no members. Principles returned with IPSTypedPrincipal.PrincipalTypes.UNDEFINED are ignored.
Throws:
PSSecurityCatalogException - if there are any errors.

getRoleMembers

Set<IPSTypedPrincipal> getRoleMembers(String roleName,
                                      IPSTypedPrincipal.PrincipalTypes type)
                                      throws PSSecurityCatalogException
Catalog the members of the specified role of the specified type.

Parameters:
roleName - The name of the role, may not be null or empty.
type - The type of principal to return, may not be null and may not be IPSTypedPrincipal.PrincipalTypes.UNDEFINED.
Returns:
A set of members, never null, may be empty if no matching role is found or if the role has no members. Principles returned with IPSTypedPrincipal.PrincipalTypes.UNDEFINED are ignored.
Throws:
PSSecurityCatalogException - if there are any errors.

getDefaultUserRoles

Set<String> getDefaultUserRoles(IPSTypedPrincipal user)
                                throws PSSecurityCatalogException
Get the list of roles that the specified user is a member of, only checking the default back-end role cataloger.

Parameters:
user - The user or group to check, may be null or emtpy to get all role names defined.
Returns:
A set of role names, never null, may be empty if the specified user is not in any roles, if a matching user is not known to the cataloger, or if no roles are defined.
Throws:
PSSecurityCatalogException - if there are any errors.

getUserRoles

Set<String> getUserRoles(IPSTypedPrincipal user)
                         throws PSSecurityCatalogException
Get the list of Rhythmyx roles that the specified user is a member of.

Parameters:
user - The user or group to check, may be null to get all role names defined.
Returns:
A set of role names, never null, may be empty if the specified user is not in any roles, if a matching user is not known to any catalogers, or if no roles are defined. The set of role names is limited to Rhythmyx roles.
Throws:
PSSecurityCatalogException - if there are any errors.

getUserGroups

Set<Principal> getUserGroups(IPSTypedPrincipal user)
Returns the list of groups of which the user is a member.

Parameters:
user - The user to check, may not be null.
Returns:
The list of groups, may be empty if the user is not a member of any groups, or if no cataloger can support this operation.

findGroups

List<Principal> findGroups(String pattern,
                           String catalogerName,
                           String type)
                           throws PSSecurityCatalogException
Returns the principals representing groups whose names match the specified filter pattern. supportsGroups(String, String) may be called before calling this method to determine if groups may be cataloged.

Parameters:
pattern - The pattern to use to match the names of the groups to find. May be null or empty to return all possible group names. Possible wildcards characters are '_' for match one character, and '%' for match any.
catalogerName - The name of the subject cataloger to query, may be null or empty to query all.
type - The cataloger type, may not be null or empty, and must match an existing cataloger type. For subject catalogers, use SUBJECT_CATALOGER_TYPE, otherwise it's the IPSDirectoryCataloger.getCatalogerType(). Ignored if catalogerName is not supplied.
Returns:
The list of group as principals for which a match was found based on the supplied pattern. May be empty if no groups match or if supportsGroups(String, String) would return false.
Throws:
PSSecurityCatalogException - if there are any errors.

getCatalogerConfigs

List<com.percussion.services.security.data.PSCatalogerConfig> getCatalogerConfigs()
                                                                                  throws com.percussion.utils.xml.PSInvalidXmlException,
                                                                                         IOException,
                                                                                         SAXException
Gets all defined cataloger configurations.

Returns:
A list of cataloger configurations, never null, may be empty.
Throws:
SAXException - If the spring config file is malformed.
IOException - If there is an error loading the spring config file.
com.percussion.utils.xml.PSInvalidXmlException - If the spring config xml is invalid.

saveCatalogerConfigs

void saveCatalogerConfigs(List<com.percussion.services.security.data.PSCatalogerConfig> configs)
                          throws com.percussion.utils.xml.PSInvalidXmlException,
                                 IOException,
                                 SAXException
Saves the list of cataloger configurations, replacing any that are currently defined. The server must be restarted for these configurations to become active.

Parameters:
configs - The configurations to save, may be empty, never null.
Throws:
SAXException - If the spring config file is malformed.
IOException - If there is an error loading the spring config file.
com.percussion.utils.xml.PSInvalidXmlException - If the spring config xml is invalid.

getGroupMembers

List<IPSTypedPrincipal> getGroupMembers(Collection<? extends Principal> groups)
Returns the members of the supplied groups. Any group that can be resolved will be removed from the supplied list of groups. Any groups that cannot be resolved will be left in the supplied list. All principals returned may be treated as users for such purposes as notification and community filtering.

Parameters:
groups - A list of principals representing group names, may be empty, never null. Any of the groups resolved by this call will be removed from the list before the method returns.
Returns:
A list of group members, may be empty if there are no members, if no groups can be resolved, or if the supplied list is empty.

getSubjectCatalogers

List<IPSSubjectCataloger> getSubjectCatalogers()
Get the list of active external subject catalogers. Does not include internal directory catalogers.

Returns:
The list of external subject catalogers, never null, may be empty. Caller owns the list; modifications to it do not affect the state of this object.

getDirectoryCatalogers

List<com.percussion.security.IPSDirectoryCataloger> getDirectoryCatalogers()
Get the names of internal directory catalogers.

Returns:
The list of directory catalogers, never null, may be empty.

isDefaultCataloger

boolean isDefaultCataloger(com.percussion.security.IPSDirectoryCataloger cataloger)
Determine if the supplied cataloger is the default backend cataloger.

Parameters:
cataloger - The cataloger to check, may not be null.
Returns:
true if it is the default cataloger, false otherwise.

supportsGroups

boolean supportsGroups(String catalogerName,
                       String type)
Determines if the specfied external subject cataloger supports group cataloging.

Parameters:
catalogerName - The name of the subject cataloger to check for group support, may not be null or empty.
type - The type of cataloger, may not be null or empty and must match an existing cataloger type. For subject catalogers, use SUBJECT_CATALOGER_TYPE, otherwise it's the IPSDirectoryCataloger.getCatalogerType().
Returns:
true if groups are supported, false if not.

getDefinedRoles

List<String> getDefinedRoles()
Get a list of the names of roles defined within Rhythmyx.

Returns:
The role names, never null, may be empty.

getRoleAttributes

Set<IPSPrincipalAttribute> getRoleAttributes(String roleName)
Gets attributes of a role defined within the Rhythmyx backend.

Parameters:
roleName - The name of the role, may not be null or empty.
Returns:
A set of attributes, never null, may be empty if the role does not have attributes defined, or if the specified role cannot be found.

setRoleCatalogers

void setRoleCatalogers(List<IPSRoleCataloger> catalogers)
Sets the list of role catalogers to use.

Parameters:
catalogers - The list, never null, may be empty.

setSubjectCatalogers

void setSubjectCatalogers(List<IPSSubjectCataloger> catalogers)
Sets the list of subject catalogers to use.

Parameters:
catalogers - The list, never null, may be empty.
